docs.lead_paragraph: Chile's president, Michelle Bachelet, unveiled plans on Saturday to ease a complete ban on abortions in the socially conservative South American country.

headline.main: Chile's Bachelet Takes on Conservatives With Plan to Ease Abortion Ban
headline.print_headline: Chile's Bachelet Takes on Conservatives With Plan to Ease Abortion Ban

docs.snippet: Chile's president, Michelle Bachelet, unveiled plans on Saturday to ease a complete ban on abortions in the socially conservative South American country.

docs.abstract: Where is the public outrage over needless suffering at the end of life?
docs.snippet: Where is the public outrage over needless suffering at the end of life?

docs.lead_paragraph: When long-time bronc rider Paul Zarzyski needed to rest his aching bones after an adrenaline-charged stint on torquing horseflesh, he often turned to the last thing most people would associate with cowboy life: writing poetry.

headline.main: Ode to the Range: Cowboys Take to Prose to Celebrate U.S. West
headline.print_headline: Ode to the Range: Cowboys Take to Prose to Celebrate U.S. West

docs.snippet: When long-time bronc rider Paul Zarzyski needed to rest his aching bones after an adrenaline-charged stint on torquing horseflesh, he often turned to the last thing most people would associate with cowboy life: writing poetry.

docs.lead_paragraph: Asking friends and family, and even strangers, to help with bills is becoming more accepted on crowdfunding websites.
docs.abstract: Retiring column; crowdfunding sites have become more popular for family members who are faced with unexpected costs of medical, nursing home and at-home care; experts say fundraising for unusual expenses generally is more successful.
docs.snippet: Asking friends and family, and even strangers, to help with bills is becoming more accepted on crowdfunding websites.

docs.lead_paragraph: The film “Still Alice” focuses attention on a disease that can devastate families emotionally and financially.

headline.main: In Alzheimer’s Cases, Financial Ruin and Abuse Are Always Lurking
headline.print_headline: In Alzheimer’s Cases, Financial Ruin and Abuse Are Always Lurking

docs.abstract: Paul Sullivan Wealth Matters column describes how movie Still Alice lays bare many of the financial issues that must be addressed when family member is diagnosed with Alzheimer's or other diseases that cause cognitive impairment; speaks with financial advisers about their experiences with clients who have had Alzheimer's.
docs.snippet: The film “Still Alice” focuses attention on a disease that can devastate families emotionally and financially.

docs.lead_paragraph: Three top U.S. Republican lawmakers, including Representative Paul Ryan, will lead an effort to craft new health reforms that could replace Obamacare, party officials said on Friday.

headline.main: Three U.S. House Republicans to Seek Obamacare Replacement
headline.print_headline: Three U.S. House Republicans to Seek Obamacare Replacement

docs.snippet: Three top U.S. Republican lawmakers, including Representative Paul Ryan, will lead an effort to craft new health reforms that could replace Obamacare, party officials said on Friday.

docs.lead_paragraph: The battle for the future of the Trump Taj Mahal casino heated up Friday as the National Labor Relations Board urged a judge to restore workers' benefits and soon-to-be-owner Carl Icahn said the cuts are "an essential sacrifice that must be made" to keep the casino open.

headline.main: Billionaire: Taj Mahal Benefit Cuts an 'Essential Sacrifice'
headline.print_headline: Billionaire: Taj Mahal Benefit Cuts an 'Essential Sacrifice'

headline.main: How to Choose the Right Hearing Aid for Your Specific Needs
headline.print_headline: How to Choose the Right Hearing Aid for Your Specific Needs

docs.lead_paragraph: Affordable Care Act opponents are taking aim at a component that would raise some $29 billion. President Obama ought to veto any bill that eliminates it.

headline.main: No Case for Killing the Medical Device Tax
headline.print_headline: No Case for Killing the Medical Device Tax

docs.abstract: Editorial opposes Republican proposal to repeal tax on medical devices as part of effort to dismantle Affordable Care Act by depriving it of source of funding; refutes industry claims that tax will lead to loss of jobs and reduced spending on research; notes tax is projected to raise $29 billion over 10 years and holds to repeal it would be damaging to United States budget and to health reform.
docs.snippet: Affordable Care Act opponents are taking aim at a component that would raise some $29 billion. President Obama ought to veto any bill that eliminates it.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: The European Central Bank’s bond buying should benefit 18.4 million people without jobs. But there is a chance it will help only a privileged few.

headline.main: Eurozone Takes on Quantitative Easing, and Its Risks
headline.print_headline: Risks and Rewards as Eurozone Prepares an Ambitious Stimulus Program

docs.abstract: European Central Bank's bond buying program, scheduled to start in March, is intended to help eurozone's 18.4 million unemployed residents, but it could have unwelcome consequences; some people, industries and countries will benefit from stimulus more than others.
docs.snippet: The European Central Bank’s bond buying should benefit 18.4 million people without jobs. But there is a chance it will help only a privileged few.
